meanings.definition: Prims (verb): to prepare or make ready
meanings.sent1: I need to prims my backpack for school tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She primsed the ingredients before starting to bake the cake.
meanings.sent3: He primsed his outfit for the party, making sure everything matched perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The chef primsed the kitchen for the busy dinner service ahead.
meanings.sent5: The team primsed their strategy before the important match.

meanings.definition: Prims (noun): the best or most perfect condition
meanings.sent1: The painting was displayed in its prims at the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps her room in prims, with everything neatly organized.
meanings.sent3: The car was restored to its prims, looking brand new again.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a prims of colorful flowers and lush greenery.
meanings.sent5: The house was decorated to prims for the holiday season.

meanings.definition: Prims (adjective): of the highest quality or excellence
meanings.sent1: They served a prims meal at the fancy restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The prims jewelry sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: His prims taste in music always impressed his friends.
meanings.sent4: The prims performance received a standing ovation.
meanings.sent5: The prims craftsmanship of the furniture was evident in every detail.
